title: WHIM Syndrome: Rare Disorder Overview
short_description: Clinical overview of WHIM syndrome, an extremely rare disorder with estimated prevalence of 0.2 per million live births.
long_description: This document provides essential epidemiological information about WHIM syndrome, a rare genetic disorder affecting both males and females equally. The content details the disorder's extremely low prevalence in the general population, estimated at approximately 0.2 cases per million live births, with only about 60 cases documented in medical literature. The document notes that onset typically occurs in infancy or early childhood, providing crucial baseline information for understanding this rare condition's demographic characteristics and clinical presentation timeline.
